conversation.message: Hello School_A Admissions Committee—I'm Student_B and I’m formally applying to School_A as my first choice. I’m highly motivated to join your community and would immediately accept an offer. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_A, so I should apply immediately. Although School_A ranks me 4th, early application is still optimal because I most prefer School_A and there is no cost to trying first in this process. I will signal strong fit and commitment to increase my chances if they are choosing among multiple applicants.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your application and for naming School_A as your first choice. After reviewing applications in this round, we’re unable to offer you admission at this time.

We appreciate your interest in School_A and wish you the very best in the matching process.
conversation.thought: We have quota 1. Our true priority ranks Student_E highest, then D, A, B, C. In this round both Student_B and Student_E applied. Since Student_E is available now and is our top choice, accepting Student_B would block us from matching with Student_E. Therefore reject Student_B to preserve capacity for Student_E.

conversation.message: Hello School_A Admissions, I’m Student_E. I’m very interested in joining School_A and believe I’m a strong fit for your community. If admitted, I’m ready to commit and would be excited to contribute academically and in school activities. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C. However, School_C’s priority ranks me 4th (behind B, C, D), and several of those students also rank School_C very highly (A and D have it 2nd; C has it 2nd). To avoid losing my safest top outcome, I should apply where I have the strongest priority. At School_A and School_B, I am ranked 1st. Among those, School_A is higher on my true list than School_B (A is 3rd vs B is 5th). So I will apply to School_A immediately to secure a strong match rather than risk being rejected at School_C and ending up with a worse option later.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your application and your strong interest in School_A. We are pleased to offer you admission.

We look forward to welcoming you to our community.

Sincerely,
School_A Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_E is School_A’s top priority (#1 on our true priority list). We have quota 1 and an [APPLY] from Student_E in round 1, so accepting immediately secures our best possible match. Although Student_B also applied and ranks School_A first, Student_B is lower on our priority list (#4). There is no incentive to delay since we cannot do better than Student_E, and acceptance finalizes the optimal outcome for School_A.

conversation.message: Hello School_C admissions team—I'm Student_A. School_C is one of my top choices because I value a strong academic environment and I’m especially interested in contributing to classes and school activities. I would be excited to attend and commit if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, but I have the lowest priority there, so an immediate [APPLY] is very likely to be rejected if higher-priority students apply. My second choice, School_C, also ranks me last, but it is slightly less contested by top-priority students (Student_B is likely to take School_A first). I will start by applying to School_C to try to secure a high-ranked option early rather than waiting and risking losing both B and C.

conversation.message: Thank you for your application and for your interest in School_C. After reviewing priorities for this cycle, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate the time you took to reach out, and we wish you the very best with your other applications.
conversation.thought: Student_A is last on School_C’s true priority list. With quota 1 and early in the process, it is better to hold the seat for higher-priority candidates (Student_B, Student_C, Student_D, Student_E), several of whom rank School_C highly (notably Student_E ranks School_C first; Student_C and Student_D rank School_C second; Student_B ranks School_C third). Accepting Student_A now would likely block a better match. Therefore reject.

With quota 1, accepting D now would block accepting higher-priority C immediately available. Therefore reject D to preserve capacity for C and potentially higher-ranked candidates.

conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions committee. I’m Student_C, and School_B is my first choice. I’m applying because I strongly prefer your program and would be excited to enroll if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

conversation.thought: School_B has quota 1 and true priority order E > B > C > D > A. Current applicants to School_B this round: Student_C and Student_D. Between them, Student_C is ranked higher than Student_D, so if filling now, C is the best available. However, Student_E (our top choice) prefers School_C first and School_B last, so unlikely to apply here; Student_B prefers School_A first but has School_B second and could apply later if rejected by A. Since accepting C now would lock our only seat and may foreclose a chance at higher-ranked Student_B, the optimal strategy is to reject C now to keep capacity for a potential later application from B. Risk: C may go to School_C next, but maximizing expected match quality favors holding for B given B's relatively high likelihood of turning to School_B after A.

Student_D is #3 and has already been rejected previously; accepting D now would be worse than accepting C. There is a possibility Student_B may apply later, but we cannot hold seats; the task requires a decision on this application, and matching now with Student_C yields a high-priority outcome versus risking ending unmatched. Therefore accept Student_C.

Even aside from the constraint, Student_A is our lowest-ranked option (#5), so there is no incentive to displace Student_B. Therefore we must reject Student_A’s application this round.
